BaseWork.description: Common representation for work and work tasks.

description.description: The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.

m_rid.description: Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended. For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

names.description: All names of this identified object.

time_schedules.description: All time schedules for this work or work task.

type.description: Utility-specific classification of this document, according to its corporate standards, practices, and existing IT systems (e.g., for management of assets, maintenance, work, outage, customers, etc.).

BaseWork.title: BaseWork

Circuit.description: A circuit representing a connection between substations. This could be an HV circuit between stations or a circuit feeding multiple secondary stations from a primary. This data element is provided to support utilities that wish to share specfic or all circuits.

demand_25_percentile.description: The 25th percentile of demand (in MW) on the circuit. This is a value calculated using historic measured values and would not necessarily be corrected for generation on the circuit and normal operating conditions.

demand_50_percentile.description: The 50th percentile of demand (in MW) on the circuit. This is a value calculated using historic measured values and would not necessarily be corrected for generation on the circuit and normal operating conditions.

demand_75_percentile.description: The 75th percentile of demand (in MW) on the circuit. This is a value calculated using historic measured values and would not necessarily be corrected for generation on the circuit and normal operating conditions.

demand_99_percentile.description: The 99th percentile of demand (in MW) on the circuit. This is a value calculated using historic measured values and would not necessarily be corrected for generation on the circuit and normal operating conditions.

demand_available_capacity.description: The available demand (in MW) capacity on the circuit. This value is calculated based on the circuit rating, maximum demand, contracted capacity, and any other constraints on the network.

demand_connected_capacity.description: Sum of all demand (in MW) currently connected on the circuit.

demand_constraint.description: A RAG definition of the demand constraints on the circuit. A utility should provide details on how this RAG status is calculated.

demand_contracted_capacity.description: Sum of all demand (in MW) currently contracted on the circuit which are not yet connected (i.e. do not include any demand that is included in demandConnectedCapacity).

demand_maximum.description: The maximum load (in MW) on the circuit. This is a value calculated using historic measured values and would not necessarily be corrected for generation on the circuit and normal operating conditions.

demand_minimum.description: The minimum demand (in MW) on the circuit. This is a value calculated using historic measured values and would not necessarily be corrected for generation on the circuit and normal operating conditions.

demand_quoted_capacity.description: Sum of all demand (in MW) currently quoted on the circuit excluding contracted and connected (i.e. does not include demandConnectedCapacity or demandContractedCapacity).

description.description: The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.

from_substation.description: mRID of the Substation the Circuit is from (used where CIM data is being produced and the mRID attributes are populated for Substations). Where no CIM mRID is yet being produced, the name of the Substation should be used.

m_rid.description: Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended. For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

names.description: All names of this identified object.

other_constraints.description: An additional constraint on the Cicruit.

requests_in_queue.description: Number of requests for new grid connections and capacity increases in queue.

summer_rating.description: Summer rating (in MW) for minimum rated section in the circuit (i.e. limiting series element).

to_substation.description: mRID of the Substations the Circuit is to (optional if LV circuits are shown but no LV/Secondary substations). Where CIM data is being produced the identifiers attributes reflect the mRID of the Substations. Where no CIM mRID is yet being produced, the names of the Substations should be used.

winter_rating.description: Winter rating (in MW) for minimum rated section in the circuit (i.e. limiting series element).

works.description: All the works performed for this circuit.

Circuit.title: Circuit

ConductingEquipment.description: The parts of the AC power system that are designed to carry current or that are conductively connected through terminals.

aggregate.description: True if the demand represents an aggregation of multiple demands all connected at a single voltage level.

description.description: The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.

m_rid.description: Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended. For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

names.description: All names of this identified object.

ConductingEquipment.title: ConductingEquipment

ConnectivityNodeContainer.description: A base class for all objects that may contain connectivity nodes or topological nodes.

description.description: The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.

m_rid.description: Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended. For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

names.description: All names of this identified object.

ConnectivityNodeContainer.title: ConnectivityNodeContainer

Constraint.description: An additional constraint/restriction on the Substation or Circuit. This is intended for non-numeric constraints e.g. to denote physical restrictions on reinforcement.

description.description: Free text for any additional descriptive data about the constraint.

type.description: The type of constraint (enumerated field to allow for easier processing/identification). Limited to Voltage, Physical or Other.

Constraint.title: Constraint

latitude.description: The latitude value of the coordinate as a single latitude/longitude point. For a GeoJSON Heatmap format this data will be part of the LineString geometry.

longitude.description: The longitude value of the coordinate as a single latitude/longitude point. For a GeoJSON Heatmap format this data will be part of the LineString geometry.

Curtailment.description: Curtailment of demand or generation capacity at the substation with optional day/time and season parameters.

curtailed_by.description: The amount the demand/generation capacity (in MW) is curtailed by.

day_type.description: The type of day the curtailment applies during (weekday or weekend).

description.description: Free text for any additional descriptive data about the curtailment.

end_time.description: The end time of a curtailment (exclusive).

season.description: The season this curtailment applies during.

start_time.description: The start time of a curtailment (inclusive).

technology_type.description: The technology the curtailment applies to e.g. for generation CHP, Wind, PV, Battery.

type.description: The type of curtailment (enumerated field to allow for easier processing/identification).

Curtailment.title: Curtailment

DateTimeInterval.description: Interval between two date and time points, where the interval includes the start time but excludes end time.

end.description: End date and time of this interval. The end date and time where the interval is defined up to, but excluded.

start.description: Start date and time of this interval.  The start date and time is included in the defined interval.

DateTimeInterval.title: DateTimeInterval

DayKind.description: The type of day the curtailment applies during (weekday or weekend).
DayKind.title: DayKind

Demand.description: Represents an individual or aggregated demand at the substation. This may represent the aggregation of all generation at a voltage level or individual connected/contracted/quoted demand.

aggregate.description: True if the demand represents an aggregation of multiple demands all connected at a single voltage level.

demand_connected_capacity.description: The currently connected demand capacity (in MW).

demand_contracted_capacity.description: The currently contracted demand capacity (in MW) which is not yet connected (i.e. do not include any demand that is included in demandConnectedCapacity).

demand_quoted_capacity.description: The currently active quoted demand capacity (in MW) excluding contracted and connected (this is optional as connected/contracted generation may not have records of quotes and after a value is contracted this value is no longer relevant).

description.description: The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.

m_rid.description: Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended. For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

names.description: All names of this identified object.

voltage.description: The voltage the demand (in kV) is connected at.

Demand.title: Demand

Document.description: Parent class for different groupings of information collected and managed as a part of a business process. It will frequently contain references to other objects, such as assets, people and power system resources.

description.description: The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.

m_rid.description: Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended. For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

names.description: All names of this identified object.

type.description: Utility-specific classification of this document, according to its corporate standards, practices, and existing IT systems (e.g., for management of assets, maintenance, work, outage, customers, etc.).

Document.title: Document

Equipment.description: The parts of a power system that are physical devices, electronic or mechanical.

aggregate.description: True if the demand represents an aggregation of multiple demands all connected at a single voltage level.

description.description: The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.

m_rid.description: Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended. For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

names.description: All names of this identified object.

Equipment.title: Equipment

EquipmentContainer.description: A modelling construct to provide a root class for containing equipment.

description.description: The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.

m_rid.description: Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended. For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

names.description: All names of this identified object.

EquipmentContainer.title: EquipmentContainer

Generator.description: Represents an individual or aggregated generator at the substation. This may represent the aggregation of all generation at a voltage level or individual connected/contracted/quoted generators.

aggregate.description: True if the demand represents an aggregation of multiple demands all connected at a single voltage level.

description.description: The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.

generation_connected_capacity.description: The currently connected generation capacity (in MW).

generation_contracted_capacity.description: The currently contracted generation capacity (in MW) excluding any that are already contracted or connected (i.e. do not include any generation that is included in generationConnectedCapacity).

generation_quoted_capacity.description: The currently active quoted generation capacity (in MW) above contracted (this is optional as connected/contracted generation may not have records of quotes and after a value is contracted this value is no longer relevant).

m_rid.description: Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended. For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

names.description: All names of this identified object.

technology_type.description: The technology the connected generation e.g. CHP, Wind, PV, Battery.

voltage.description: The voltage the generator (in kV) is connected at.

Generator.title: Generator

Geometry.description: The geometry of the line, this will be one or more Lines i.e. series of ordered coordinates. Multiple Lines allowed to allow for radial geometries. It is likely that this will be rendered as a GeoJSON geometry in that format.
Geometry.title: Geometry

HeatmapDataSet.description: A single instance of a published dataset. The descriptions of these fields are taken from the Dublin Core Standard.

circuits.description: A list of circuits with heatmap data.

conforms_to.description: ID for the schema used to create the instance data.

contributor.description: An entity responsible for making contributions to the resource.

coverage.description: The spatial or temporal topic of the resource, spatial applicability of the resource, or jurisdiction under which the resource is relevant.

creator.description: An entity responsible for making the resource.

date.description: A point of time associated with an event in the lifecycle of the resource. For this implementation this will represent the date the data set is valid from.

description.description: An account of the resource.

format.description: The file format of the resource.

identifier.description: An unambiguous reference to the resource within a given context.

issued.description: Date of formal issuance of the resource.

postcode_areas.description: Postcode Areas associated with the heatmap data.

publisher.description: An entity responsible for making the resource available.

rights.description: Information about rights held in and over the resource.

substations.description: A list of substations with heatmap data.

title.description: A name given to the resource.

valid.description: A date range for the validity of a resource. This should be two dates to form a range.  The first date is inclusive and the second date exclusive.

HeatmapDataSet.title: HeatmapDataSet

IdentifiedObject.description: This is a root class to provide common identification for all classes needing identification and naming attributes.

description.description: The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.

m_rid.description: Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended. For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

names.description: All names of this identified object.

IdentifiedObject.title: IdentifiedObject

LimitingFactorKind.description: The limiting factor for demand/generation constraints.
LimitingFactorKind.title: LimitingFactorKind

coordinates.description: Two (2) or more coordinates for a line.

Name.description: The Name class provides the means to define any number of human readable names for an object. A name is not to be used for defining inter-object relationships. For inter-object relationships instead use the object identification 'mRID'
Name.title: Name

NameType.description: Type of name. Possible values for attribute 'name' are implementation dependent but standard profiles may specify types. An enterprise may have multiple IT systems each having its own local name for the same object, e.g.  a planning system may have different names from an EMS. An object may also have different names within the same IT system, e.g. localName as defined in CIM version 14. The definition from CIM14 is The localName is a human readable name of the object. It is a free text name local to a node in a naming hierarchy similar to a file directory structure. A power system related naming hierarchy may be Substation, VoltageLevel, Equipment etc. Children of the same parent in such a hierarchy have names that typically are unique among them.

description.description: Description of the name type.

name_type_authority.description: Authority responsible for managing names of this type.

NameType.title: NameType

NameTypeAuthority.description: Authority responsible for creation and management of names of a given type; typically an organization or an enterprise system.

description.description: Description of the name type authority.

NameTypeAuthority.title: NameTypeAuthority

PostcodeArea.description: A geographic region that is defined by the initial letters or digits of a postcode.

demand_available_capacity.description: The available demand capacity (in MW) at the postcode area. This value is calculated based on total firm capacity, maximum demand, connected capacity, quoted capacity, contracted capacity, and any other constraints on the network. The value should reflect the capacity a network operator would make available to a connecting party, which may be calculated for the most onerous season, or a value based on more detailed analysis and internal policies.

demand_connected_capacity.description: Sum of all demand (in MW) currently connected at the postcode area. This includes individual demands and storage that are explicitly defined and aggregate value of other connect demands and storage. The value for demandConnectedCapacity must be greater than or equal to the sum of the demandConnectedCapacity values in the Demand and Storage elements.

demand_constraint.description: A RAG definition of the demand constraints at the postcode area. A utility should provide details on how this RAG status is calculated as part of the accompanying documentation.

demand_constraint_limiting_factor.description: The limiting factor for demand constraints, either thermal, voltage or fault level for the demandConstraint value.

demand_contracted_capacity.description: Sum of all demand (in MW) currently contracted at the postcode area which is not yet connected (i.e. do not include any demand that is included in demandConnectedCapacity). This includes individual demands and storage that are explicitly defined and aggregate value of other connect demands and storage. The value for demandContractedCapacity must be greater than or equal to the sum of the demandContractedCapacity values in the Demand and Storage elements.

demand_firm_capacity.description: The firm capacity (in MW) for demand at the postcode area. Any constraints that impact this capacity should be listed as individual constraints linked to the substation.

demand_maximum.description: The maximum demand (in MW) at the postcode area. This is a normalised value calculated using historic measured values during normal operating conditions. The data represents net demand without removing the impact of any generation on observed demand at the substation, demand diversity factors, and any other internal processing normally undertaken. All substations at 33kV and above must include demand data; for substations below 33kV, if corrected, net demand data is not available, the value should be omitted. Users wishing to see separate summer/winter peaks can obtain this from the data.

demand_minimum.description: The minimum demand (in MW) at the postcode area. This is a normalised value calculated using historic measured values during normal operating conditions. The data represents net demand corrected for any generation at the substation, demand diversity factors, and any other internal processing normally undertaken. All substations at 33kV and above must include demand data; for substations below 33kV, if corrected, net demand data is not available, the value should be omitted. Users wishing to see separate summer/winter peaks can obtain this from the data.

demand_quoted_capacity.description: Sum of all demand (in MW) currently quoted at the postcode area excluding contracted and connected (i.e. does not include demandConnectedCapacity or demandContractedCapacity). This includes individual demands and storage that are explicitly defined and aggregate value of other connect demands and storage. The value for demandQuotedCapacity must be greater than or equal to the sum of the demandQuotedCapacity values in the demand and Storage elements.

demands.description: The demands at the postcode area covering connected, contracted and quoted. This data is optional and may aggregated into the substation attributes, but utilities may optionally provide details on individual demands.

description.description: The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.

generation_available_capacity.description: Available generation capacity (in MW) at the postcode area. This value is calculated based on total firm generation, capacity, demand, connected capacity, contracted capacity, and any other constraints on the network.

generation_connected_capacity.description: Sum of all generation (in MW) currently connected at the postcode area.  This includes individual generation and storage that are explicitly defined and aggregate value of other connect generation and storage.  The value forgenerationConnectedCapacity must be greater than or equal to the sum of the generationConnectedCapacity values in the Generator and Storage elements.

generation_constraint.description: A RAG definition of the demand constraints at the substation. A utility should provide details on how this RAG status is calculated as part of the accompanying documentation

generation_constraint_limiting_factor.description: The limiting factor for generation constraints, either thermal or fault level for the generationConstraint value.

generation_contracted_capacity.description: Sum of all generation (in MW) currently contracted at the postcode area which is not yet connected (i.e. do not include any generation that is included in generationConnectedCapacity). This includes individual generation and storage that are explicitly defined and aggregate value of other connect generation and storage. The value for generationContractedCapacity must be greater than or equal to the sum of the generationContractedCapacity values in the Generator and Storage elements.

generation_firm_capacity.description: The total firm generation capacity (in MW) of the postcode area. Any constraints that impact this capacity should be listed as individual constraints linked to the postcode area. The approach used to calculate this value should be defined in accompanying documentation.

generation_quoted_capacity.description: Sum of all currently quoted generation (in MW) at the postcode area excluding any that are already contracted or connected. This includes individual generation and storage that are explicitly defined and aggregate value of other connect generation and storage. The value for generationQuotedCapacity must be greater than or equal to the sum of the generationQuotedCapacity values in the Generator and Storage elements.

generators.description: The generators at the postcode area covering connected, contracted and quoted. This data is optional and may aggregated into the substation attributes, but utilities may optionally provide details on individual generators.

m_rid.description: Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended. For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

names.description: All names of this identified object.

other_constraints.description: An additional constraint on the postcode area.

postcode.description: Identifier for the postcode area. Contain four (4) numbers, followed by two (2) letters, lowercase. No spaces between the numbers and letters, i.e. "1234ab".

requests_in_queue.description: Number of requests for new grid connections and capacity increases in queue.

storage.description: The storage devices at the postcode area covering connected, contracted and quoted. This data is optional and may aggregated into the substation attributes, but utilities may optionally provide details on individual storage devices.

works.description: All the works performed for this postcode area.

PostcodeArea.title: PostcodeArea

PowerSystemResource.description: A power system resource (PSR) can be an item of equipment such as a switch, an equipment container containing many individual items of equipment such as a substation, or an organisational entity such as sub-control area.  Power system resources can have measurements associated.

description.description: The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.

m_rid.description: Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended. For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

names.description: All names of this identified object.

PowerSystemResource.title: PowerSystemResource

RAGKind.description: Traffic light colors coding scheme for categorising status.
RAGKind.title: RAGKind

SeasonKind.description: The season this curtailment applies during.
SeasonKind.title: SeasonKind

Storage.description: Represents an individual or aggregated storage at the substation. This may represent the aggregation of all storage at a voltage level or individual connected/contracted/quoted storage.

aggregate.description: True if the demand represents an aggregation of multiple demands all connected at a single voltage level.

demand_connected_capacity.description: The currently connected demand capacity (in MW).

demand_contracted_capacity.description: The currently contracted demand capacity (in MW) which is not yet connected (i.e. do not include any demand that is included in demandConnectedCapacity).

demand_quoted_capacity.description: The currently active quoted demand capacity (in MW) excluding contracted and connected (this is optional as connected/contracted generation may not have records of quotes and after a value is contracted this value is no longer relevant).

description.description: The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.

generation_connected_capacity.description: The currently connected generation capacity (in MW).

generation_contracted_capacity.description: The currently contracted generation capacity (in MW) excluding any that are already contracted or connected (i.e. do not include any generation that is included in generationConnectedCapacity).

generation_quoted_capacity.description: The currently active quoted generation capacity (in MW) above contracted (this is optional as connected/contracted generation may not have records of quotes and after a value is contracted this value is no longer relevant).

m_rid.description: Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended. For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

names.description: All names of this identified object.

technology_type.description: The technology of the connected generation e.g. PumpStorage, Battery.

voltage.description: The voltage the storage (in kV) is connected at.

Storage.title: Storage

Substation.description: A Substation with connect demand, generation or storage.

area.description: The name of the license area. This should be the EAN used in the license for the system operator.

coordinates.description: The longitude/latitude value of the substation as a single latitude/longitude point. For a GeoJSON Heatmap format this data will be part of the feature itself allowing for more complex geometry.

demand_25_percentile.description: The 25th percentile of demanding (in MW) at the substation. This is a normalised value calculated using historic measured values during normal operating conditions. The data represents net demand corrected for any generation at the substation, demand diversity factors, and any other internal processing normally undertaken. All substations at 50kV and above must include demand data; for substations below 50kV, if corrected, net demand data is not available, the value should be omitted.

demand_50_percentile.description: The 50th percentile of demanding (in MW) at the substation. This is a normalised value calculated using historic measured values during normal operating conditions. The data represents net demand corrected for any generation at the substation, demand diversity factors, and any other internal processing normally undertaken. All substations at 50kV and above must include demand data; for substations below 50kV, if corrected, net demand data is not available, the value should be omitted.

demand_75_percentile.description: The 75th percentile of demanding (in MW) at the substation.  This is a normalised value calculated using historic measured values during normal operating conditions.  The data represents net demand corrected for any generation at the substation, demand diversity factors, and any other internal processing normally undertaken. All substations at 50kV and above must include demand data; for substations below 50kV, if corrected, net demand data is not available, the value should be omitted.

demand_99_percentile.description: The 99th percentile of demanding (in MW) at the substation.  This is a normalised value calculated using historic measured values during normal operating conditions.  The data represents net demand corrected for any generation at the substation, demand diversity factors, and any other internal processing normally undertaken. All substations at 50kV and above must include demand data; for substations below 50kV, if corrected, net demand data is not available, the value should be omitted.

demand_available_capacity.description: The available demand capacity (in MW) at the substation. This value is calculated based on total firm capacity, maximum demand, connected capacity, quoted capacity, contracted capacity, and any other constraints on the network. The value should reflect the capacity a network operator would make available to a connecting party, which may be calculated for the most onerous season, or a value based on more detailed analysis and internal policies.

demand_connected_capacity.description: Sum of all demand (in MW) currently connected at the substation. This includes individual demands and storage that are explicitly defined and aggregate value of other connect demands and storage. The value for demandConnectedCapacity must be greater than or equal to the sum of the demandConnectedCapacity values in the demand and Storage elements.

demand_constraint.description: A RAG definition of the demand constraints at the substation. A utility should provide details on how this RAG status is calculated as part of the accompanying documentation.

demand_constraint_limiting_factor.description: The limiting factor for demand constraints, either thermal, voltage or fault level for the demandConstraint value.

demand_contracted_capacity.description: Sum of all demand (in MW) currently contracted at the substation which is not yet connected (i.e. do not include any demand that is included in demandConnectedCapacity). This includes individual demands and storage that are explicitly defined and aggregate value of other connect demands and storage. The value for demandContractedCapacity must be greater than or equal to the sum of the demandContractedCapacity values in the Demand and Storage elements.

demand_firm_capacity.description: The firm capacity (in MW) for demand at the substation. Any constraints that impact this capacity should be listed as individual constraints linked to the substation.

demand_maximum.description: The maximum demand (in MW) at the substation. This is a normalised value calculated using historic measured values during normal operating conditions. The data represents net demand without removing the impact of any generation on observed demand at the substation, demand diversity factors, and any other internal processing normally undertaken. All substations at 33kV and above must include demand data; for substations below 33kV, if corrected, net demand data is not available, the value should be omitted. Users wishing to see separate summer/winter peaks can obtain this from the data.

demand_minimum.description: The minimum demand (in MW) at the substation. This is a normalised value calculated using historic measured values during normal operating conditions. The data represents net demand corrected for any generation at the substation, demand diversity factors, and any other internal processing normally undertaken. All substations at 33kV and above must include demand data; for substations below 33kV, if corrected, net demand data is not available, the value should be omitted. Users wishing to see separate summer/winter peaks can obtain this from the data.

demand_quoted_capacity.description: Sum of all demand (in MW) currently quoted at the substation excluding contracted and connected (i.e. does not include demandConnectedCapacity or demandContractedCapacity). This includes individual demands and storage that are explicitly defined and aggregate value of other connect demands and storage. The value for demandQuotedCapacity must be greater than or equal to the sum of the demandQuotedCapacity values in the demand and Storage elements.

demands.description: The demands at the station covering connected, contracted and quoted. This data is optional and may aggregated into the substation attributes, but utilities may optionally provide details on individual demands.

description.description: The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.

generation_available_capacity.description: Available generation capacity (in MW) at the substation. This value is calculated based on total firm generation, capacity, demand, connected capacity, contracted capacity, and any other constraints on the network.

generation_connected_capacity.description: Sum of all generation (in MW) currently connected at the substation. This includes individual generation and storage that are explicitly defined and aggregate value of other connect generation and storage. The value forgenerationConnectedCapacity must be greater than or equal to the sum of the generationConnectedCapacity values in the Generator and Storage elements.

generation_constraint.description: A RAG definition of the demand constraints at the substation. A utility should provide details on how this RAG status is calculated as part of the accompanying documentation

generation_constraint_limiting_factor.description: The limiting factor for generation constraints, either thermal or fault level for the generationConstraint value.

generation_contracted_capacity.description: Sum of all generation (in MW) currently contracted at the substation which is not yet connected (i.e. do not include any generation that is included in generationConnectedCapacity). This includes individual generation and storage that are explicitly defined and aggregate value of other connect generation and storage. The value for generationContractedCapacity must be greater than or equal to the sum of the generationContractedCapacity values in the Generator and Storage elements.

generation_firm_capacity.description: The total firm generation capacity (in MW) of the substation.  Any constraints that impact this capacity should be listed as individual constraints linked to the substation. The approach used to calculate this value should be defined in accompanying documentation.

generation_quoted_capacity.description: Sum of all currently quoted generation (in MW) at the substation excluding any that are already contracted or connected. This includes individual generation and storage that are explicitly defined and aggregate value of other connect generation and storage. The value for generationQuotedCapacity must be greater than or equal to the sum of the generationQuotedCapacity values in the Generator and Storage elements.

generators.description: The generators at the station covering connected, contracted and quoted. This data is optional and may aggregated into the substation attributes, but utilities may optionally provide details on individual generators.

m_rid.description: Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended. For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

names.description: All names of this identified object.

other_constraints.description: An additional constraint on the Substation.

requests_in_queue.description: Number of requests for new grid connections and capacity increases in queue.

reverse_power_flow_available_capacity.description: The available reverse capacity (in MW) for the substation from lower to higher voltage levels.

reverse_power_flow_total_capacity.description: The reverse capacity (in MW) for the substation from lower to higher voltage levels. 0 if there are no reverse powerflow capabilities.

short_code.description: Short code name for substation (alphanumeric, uppercase letters only).

storage.description: The storage devices at the station covering connected, contracted and quoted. This data is optional and may aggregated into the substation attributes, but utilities may optionally provide details on individual storage devices.

voltages.description: The voltages at the Substation in Kilovolts (kV).

works.description: All the works performed for this substation.

Substation.title: Substation

TimeSchedule.description: Description of anything that changes through time. Time schedule is used to perform a single-valued function of time. Use inherited 'type' attribute to give additional information on this schedule, such as periodic (hourly, daily, weekly, monthly, etc.), day of the month, by date, calendar (specific times and dates).

description.description: The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.

m_rid.description: Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended. For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

names.description: All names of this identified object.

type.description: Utility-specific classification of this document, according to its corporate standards, practices, and existing IT systems (e.g., for management of assets, maintenance, work, outage, customers, etc.).

TimeSchedule.title: TimeSchedule

Work.description: Document used to request, initiate, track and record work.

description.description: The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.

m_rid.description: Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended. For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

names.description: All names of this identified object.

request_date_time.description: Date and time work was requested.

time_schedules.description: All time schedules for this work or work task.

type.description: Utility-specific classification of this document, according to its corporate standards, practices, and existing IT systems (e.g., for management of assets, maintenance, work, outage, customers, etc.).

work_order_number.description: Work order number (or other unique identifying information) for this work.

Work.title: Work

WorkStatusKind.description: Kind of status, specific to work.
WorkStatusKind.title: WorkStatusKind

description.description: The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.

m_rid.description: Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended. For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

names.description: All names of this identified object.

type.description: Utility-specific classification of this document, according to its corporate standards, practices, and existing IT systems (e.g., for management of assets, maintenance, work, outage, customers, etc.).
